content: 2 of 4 note this scarf is reversible but for the pattern the even row will be considered the right side special stitches lsc long single_crochet also known as a spike stitch - to work a lsc single_crochet in st indicated 2 row below at the bottom of the single_crochet see photos below row 4 turn single_crochet in first st * work lsc in next st single_crochet in next st * repeat from * across mf row 5 turn single_crochet across mf change to other color if using row 6 turn single_crochet in first st * work fphdc around lsc single_crochet in next st* repeat from * across mf row 7 repeat row 5 row 8 turn single_crochet in first st single_crochet in next st * work lsc single_crochet in next st * repeat from * across single_crochet in last st mf row 9 repeat row 5 row 10 turn single_crochet in first st single_crochet in next st *work fphdc around lsc single_crochet in next st* repeat from * across single_crochet in last st mf row 11 repeat row 5 row 12-23 repeat row 4-11 ending on a row 5 row 24 mf turn single_crochet across mf cut yarn note if you want a wider scarf keep repeating row 4-11 ending on a row 5 and then work row 24 the hannah scarf page 3 of 4 finishing weave in all loose ends block scarf gently if necessary pattern created by sonja m otto ©2025 the hannah scarf page 4 of 4
